definitions: circular arena where bullfights take place in front of spectators
examples: The bullring in Seville attracts thousands of tourists annually
Matadors practiced their movements in the empty bullring

definitions: deceptive or false talk intended to mislead or impress others
solid waste matter expelled from a bull's digestive system
examples: His explanation was complete bullshit from start to finish
Don't believe their bullshit about guaranteed profits
The farmer cleared bullshit from the barn every morning
Fresh bullshit makes excellent fertilizer for crops

definitions: person who habitually seeks to harm or intimidate those perceived as vulnerable
preserved beef prepared in tins, originally supplied to armies
examples: The school bully targeted smaller students during recess
Workplace bullies create toxic environments for their colleagues
Soldiers survived on bully beef during the campaign
The emergency rations included bully and hardtack biscuits

definitions: repeated aggressive behavior intended to hurt another person physically or emotionally
examples: Cyberbullying has become a serious problem among teenagers
The company implemented strict policies against workplace bullying

definitions: solid defensive wall or similar structure built for protection
something that acts as a defense or safeguard against danger
examples: The castle's bulwark withstood centuries of attacks
Stone bulwarks protected the harbor from ocean waves
Democracy serves as a bulwark against tyranny
Free press remains our bulwark against government corruption

definitions: informal term for the human buttocks or rear end
person without a home who typically begs for money
something of inferior quality or that doesn't work properly
examples: He fell hard on his bum during skating practice
The toddler landed on her bum with a thump
The old bum asked passersby for spare change
Several bums gathered near the railway station nightly
That printer is a bum and constantly jams
He got a bum deal on that used car

definitions: large hairy bee that makes a loud humming sound while flying
examples: A bumblebee collected pollen from the sunflower garden
Bumblebees are essential pollinators for tomato plants

definitions: swelling on the body caused by injury or inflammation
light blow or collision between two objects or people
small raised area on a surface making it uneven
examples: A large bump formed on his forehead after hitting the door
The mosquito bite left an itchy bump on her arm
The cars experienced a minor bump in the parking lot
She felt a bump when the plane hit turbulence
Drive slowly over the speed bump near the school
The road has several bumps that need repair

definitions: protective bar attached to front or rear of a vehicle
exceptionally large or successful harvest or production
examples: The bumper absorbed most of the impact during the collision
Chrome bumpers were standard on classic cars
Farmers celebrated a bumper crop of wheat this year
The company reported bumper profits this quarter

definitions: small round sweet or plain bread often used for sandwiches
hairstyle where hair is drawn back and twisted into a knot
examples: She ordered a hamburger on a sesame seed bun
The bakery sells fresh cinnamon buns every morning
The ballerina wore her hair in a tight bun
She quickly twisted her hair into a messy bun

definitions: things of the same kind fastened or grouped together
informal term for a group of people
examples: She bought a bunch of bananas from the market
A bunch of keys jangled in his pocket
A bunch of teenagers gathered at the mall
The whole bunch went to see the movie together

definitions: collection of things tied or wrapped together for carrying
group of products or services sold together as one unit
large amount of money or significant quantity
examples: She carried a bundle of firewood into the cabin
The postman delivered a bundle of letters
The software bundle includes five different programs
They offer a bundle deal with internet and cable
That antique painting must have cost a bundle
He made a bundle investing in technology stocks

definitions: practice of grouping products or services together for sale as one unit
historical practice where unmarried couples shared a bed while fully clothed
examples: Product bundling increased the company's average transaction value
Cable companies use bundling to retain customers
Bundling was common in colonial American courtship practices
The practice of bundling included placing boards between couples

definitions: stopper for closing the hole in a barrel or cask
act of throwing something somewhere carelessly or roughly
examples: The winemaker replaced the wooden bung in the barrel
A rubber bung sealed the fermentation vessel
Just bung those boxes in the storage room
He bunged the report on my desk without explanation

definitions: low house having only one story or sometimes upper rooms in the roof
examples: They retired to a cozy bungalow near the beach
The craftsman bungalow featured exposed wooden beams

definitions: strong elastic cord used especially for bungee jumping or securing items
examples: The bungee cord stretched as the jumper plummeted downward
He used bungee cords to secure luggage on the roof

definitions: mistake or failure typically caused by incompetence or carelessness
examples: The robbery was a complete bungle from start to finish
His bungle cost the company thousands in damages

definitions: narrow bed typically stacked in tiers for space efficiency
foolish or untrue talk that lacks credibility or substance
examples: The sailors slept in bunks below deck
Summer camp cabins had bunk beds for campers
That theory about aliens is complete bunk
Don't believe such bunk about overnight success

definitions: reinforced underground shelter designed for protection during warfare
sand-filled hollow on a golf course presenting an obstacle
large container or compartment for storing fuel especially on ships
examples: Soldiers took cover in the concrete bunker during bombardment
The president was evacuated to an underground bunker
His ball landed in the bunker near the green
She practiced bunker shots at the driving range
The ship's bunker held enough fuel for the voyage
Coal bunkers supplied the power station's furnaces

definitions: informal or child's word for a rabbit
attractive young woman especially as waitress in certain clubs
examples: The children fed carrots to the bunny
Easter bunnies decorated the spring display
The club employed bunnies as cocktail waitresses
Playboy bunnies became cultural icons of the 1960s

definitions: gas burner used in laboratories producing a hot flame for heating
examples: Students heated test tubes over the bunsen burner
The bunsen flame turned blue when properly adjusted

definitions: baseball hitting technique where the batter taps the ball softly
fungal disease affecting wheat characterized by masses of black spores
examples: The player executed a perfect bunt down the third baseline
A sacrifice bunt advanced the runner to second base
Wheat bunt destroyed much of the harvest
Farmers treated seeds to prevent bunt infection

definitions: strings of colorful flags or fabric used for festive decoration
small seed-eating songbird with a short thick bill
examples: Colorful bunting decorated the streets for the festival
They hung bunting across the shop for the grand opening
A snow bunting perched on the garden fence
Reed buntings nest in wetland areas

definitions: floating object anchored in water to mark channels or warn of hazards
examples: Red buoys mark the right side of the channel
The life buoy saved the drowning swimmer

definitions: upward force exerted by fluid that opposes weight of immersed object
cheerful and optimistic attitude or feeling that lifts spirits
examples: The life jacket's buoyancy kept him afloat
Scientists calculated the buoyancy of the submarine
Her natural buoyancy lifted everyone's spirits
Market buoyancy reflected investor confidence

definitions: prickly covering of seeds that clings to clothing or fur
examples: Burs stuck to the dog's fur during the walk
She picked burs from her woolen sweater

definitions: heavy load that is carried or something difficult to bear
duty or responsibility that causes worry, difficulty, or hardship
examples: The donkey carried a heavy burden up the mountain
Workers struggled under the burden of equipment
Financial burdens prevented them from buying a house
The burden of proof lies with the prosecution

definitions: government department or administrative unit dealing with specific affairs
piece of furniture with drawers for storing clothes
office or agency that collects and distributes news
examples: The Federal Bureau of Investigation handles domestic security
She works for the census bureau
The antique bureau contained her grandmother's linens
He placed his watch on top of the bureau
The news bureau reported from the conflict zone
Several press bureaus covered the election

definitions: system of government where decisions are made by state officials
excessively complicated administrative procedure marked by red tape
examples: The federal bureaucracy employs millions of workers
Ancient Chinese bureaucracy developed sophisticated administrative systems
Getting permits requires navigating endless bureaucracy
Corporate bureaucracy slowed innovation and decision-making

definitions: official in a government department concerned with procedural correctness
examples: The bureaucrat insisted on proper documentation for everything
Career bureaucrats maintained continuity despite political changes

definitions: informal term for a city or town especially a small one
examples: They moved from the big city to a quiet burg
This sleepy burg hasn't changed in decades

definitions: flat round cake of minced meat typically served in a bun
examples: She ordered a cheeseburger with extra pickles
Veggie burgers have become increasingly popular

definitions: Scottish borough or chartered town with certain privileges
examples: Edinburgh remains Scotland's most famous burgh
The royal burgh granted trading privileges to merchants

definitions: citizen of a town or city typically a member of the wealthy bourgeoisie
examples: Wealthy burghers built grand houses in the town center
Medieval burghers controlled trade and commerce

definitions: person who illegally enters buildings with intent to steal
examples: The burglar entered through an unlocked window
Security cameras deterred potential burglars

definitions: crime of illegally entering a building with intent to commit theft
examples: Police investigated three burglaries in the neighborhood
Home burglary rates decreased after installing security systems

definitions: red wine from the Burgundy region of France
dark red color similar to red wine
examples: They served an excellent burgundy with dinner
The sommelier recommended a vintage burgundy
She wore a burgundy dress to the gala
The leather sofa came in burgundy or black

definitions: act or ceremony of burying a dead body in the ground
examples: The burial took place at the family cemetery
Ancient burial sites reveal much about past cultures

definitions: rounded knotty growth on a tree valued for decorative wood grain
examples: The woodworker crafted a bowl from walnut burl
Burl wood commands high prices from furniture makers

definitions: coarse canvas woven from jute, hemp, or similar fibers
examples: Coffee beans arrived in burlap sacks
They wrapped the tree roots in burlap for transplanting

definitions: theatrical entertainment featuring comedy, striptease, and variety acts
literary or dramatic work that seeks to ridicule through exaggeration
examples: The burlesque show featured elaborate costumes and comedy
1920s burlesque influenced modern cabaret performances
His burlesque of Shakespeare amused the literary critics
The play was a burlesque of political conventions

definitions: injury caused by exposure to heat, chemicals, electricity, or radiation
area of land or forest consumed or damaged by fire
small stream especially in Scotland and Northern England
examples: The burn on her hand required medical attention
Sunburns can cause serious skin damage
The forest burn covered hundreds of acres
Controlled burns help prevent larger wildfires
They picnicked beside a babbling burn
Trout swim in the highland burns

definitions: part of a stove or furnace that produces flame or heat
prepaid mobile phone used temporarily to maintain anonymity
examples: She turned the burner to low heat
The gas burner needed cleaning
Drug dealers often use burner phones
He bought a burner for the overseas trip

definitions: process of combustion producing heat, light, and often smoke
intense feeling or sensation often of heat or strong emotion
examples: The burning of fossil fuels contributes to climate change
Controlled burning helps manage forest growth
She felt a burning sensation in her muscles
His burning ambition drove him to success

definitions: enveloping outer garment worn by some Muslim women covering the entire body
examples: She chose to wear a burqa in public spaces
The blue burqa provided complete coverage

definitions: rough edge or ridge left on metal or other material
pronunciation characterized by a rough or rolling r sound
rotary cutting tool used in drilling or shaping
examples: He filed away the burr from the metal edge
Sharp burrs needed smoothing before assembly
His Scottish burr made his speech distinctive
The actor adopted a slight burr for the role
The dentist used a diamond burr to shape the tooth
Different burr sizes served various drilling needs

definitions: Mexican dish consisting of a flour tortilla wrapped around various fillings
examples: The breakfast burrito contained eggs, beans, and cheese
She ordered a chicken burrito with extra guacamole

definitions: small donkey used as a pack animal especially in southwestern United States
examples: Burros carried supplies up the mountain trail
Wild burros roam the desert regions

definitions: hole or tunnel dug by an animal for shelter or habitation
examples: The rabbit disappeared into its burrow
Prairie dogs create extensive burrow systems underground

definitions: person who manages financial affairs especially at a college or university
examples: The bursar handled all student tuition payments
She met with the bursar about her scholarship
